subject: Olympic Games
lead_paragraph: Athletes in line for medals given up by Marion Jones must have no drug history. “This is not going to be an automatic upgrade,” said Jacques Rogge, the International Olympic Committee president. The decision means the Greek sprinter Katerina Thanou, at the center of a drug scandal at the 2004 Athens Games, may not receive the 100-meter gold Jones won at the 2000 Sydney Olympics. Jones, who won three gold medals and two bronze in Sydney, last month admitted using performance-enhancing drugs before the 2000 Olympics.
